v.v: Who has believed what they heard from us, and to whom has the arm of Yahweh been revealed?
For he grew up before Yahweh like a sapling, and like a sprout out of parched earth;
He was despised and rejected by people; a man of sorrows, and one familiar with pain.
But surely he has borne our sicknesses and carried our sorrows;
But he was pierced because of our rebellious deeds; he was crushed because of our sins.
We all like sheep have gone astray; we have each turned to his own way,
He was oppressed; yet when he humbled himself, he did not open his mouth;
By coercion and judgment he was condemned; who from that generation thought anymore about him?
They placed his grave with the criminals, with a rich man in his death,
Yet it was Yahweh’s will to crush him and make him ill. When he makes his life an offering for sin,
After the suffering of his life, he will see light and be satisfied by his knowledge.
Therefore will I give him his portion among the multitudes, and he will divide the spoils with the many,

v: he had no remarkable appearance or splendor; when we saw him, there was no beauty to attract us.
Like one from whom men hide their faces, he was despised; and we considered him insignificant.
yet we thought he was being punished by God, struck by God, and afflicted.
The punishment for our peace was on him, and with his wounds we are healed.
and Yahweh has placed on him the iniquity of us all.
as a lamb that is led to the slaughter, and as a sheep that before its shearers is silent,
so he did not open his mouth.
But he was cut off from the land of the living; because of the offenses of my people the penalty was put on him.
although he had done no violence, nor had there been any deceit in his mouth.
he will see his offspring, he will prolong his days, and Yahweh’s purpose will be accomplished through him.
My righteous servant will justify many; he will bear their iniquities.
because he exposed himself to death and was numbered with the transgressors.
He bore the sin of many and made intercession for the transgressors.
